meanings.definition: The quality or state of being dorsiventral.
meanings.sent1: The dorsiventralities of the leaf help it absorb sunlight efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Botanists study the dorsiventralities of plant structures to understand their functions better.
meanings.sent3: The quirky scientist joked that the dorsiventralities of the leaf made it look like a tiny green umbrella.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the artist used the concept of dorsiventralities to create a visually striking painting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun song to teach her students about the dorsiventralities of leaves.

meanings.definition: The condition of having two surfaces differing from each other in appearance or structure, as in certain leaves.
meanings.sent1: The dorsiventralities of the leaf make it easy to identify in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The botanist explained how the dorsiventralities of the leaf aid in photosynthesis.
meanings.sent3: The children found a leaf with unusual dorsiventralities and pretended it was a secret map.
meanings.sent4: The artist used the idea of dorsiventralities in nature to inspire a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The vivid colors of the leaf highlighted its dorsiventralities under the sunlight.
